item.title: 拜登和中国习近平将在亚太经合组织峰会上讨论沟通和竞争
item.description:
The White House said on Monday President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping will discuss strengthening communication and managing competition when they meet at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in the San Francisco Bay area on Nov. 15.翻译:白宫周一表示，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平将于 11 月 15 日在旧金山湾区举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 峰会上会面，讨论加强沟通和管理竞争问题。

Biden believes there is no substitute for face-to-face diplomacy to manage this complex relationship, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan told reporters.翻译:白宫国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文告诉记者，拜登认为，处理这种复杂关系时，面对面的外交是无可替代的。

"We anticipate that the leaders will discuss some of the most fundamental elements of the U.S.-PRC bilateral relationship, including the continued importance of strengthening open lines of communication and managing competition responsibly so that it does not veer into conflict," Sullivan told reporters.翻译:沙利文对记者表示：“我们预计领导人将讨论美中双边关系的一些最基本要素，包括加强开放的沟通渠道和负责任地管理竞争以使其不会陷入冲突的持续重要性。”

"The way we achieve that is through intense diplomacy. That's how we clear up misperceptions and avoid surprises," Sullivan said, adding Biden "comes into this summit on a solid footing."翻译:沙利文说：“我们实现这一目标的方法是通过激烈的外交。这就是我们消除误解并避免意外的方法。”他补充说，拜登“以坚实的基础参加这次峰会”。

Sullivan also said the U.S. is looking for specific outcomes from the meeting on November 15, he said.翻译:沙利文还表示，美国正在寻求 11 月 15 日会议的具体成果。

The face-to-face meeting will take place for the first time in a year on Wednesday, with the high-stakes diplomacy aimed at curbing tensions between the world's two superpowers.翻译:这次面对面会议将于周三举行一年来的首次，此次高风险外交旨在遏制世界两个超级大国之间的紧张局势。

The meeting is also expected to cover global issues from the Israel-Hamas war to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, North Korea's ties with Russia, Taiwan, the Indo-Pacific, human rights, fentanyl, artificial intelligence, as well as "fair" trade and economic relations, senior Biden administration officials said.翻译:预计这次会议还将涵盖从以色列-哈马斯战争到俄罗斯入侵乌克兰、朝鲜与俄罗斯、台湾、印度-太平洋地区的关系、人权、芬太尼、人工智能以及“公平”贸易和发展等全球问题。拜登政府高级官员表示，经济关系。

Reporting by Steve Holland and Nandita Bose in Washington; Editing by Chris Reese and Alistair Bell翻译:Steve Holland 和 Nandita Bose 在华盛顿的报道；克里斯·里斯和阿利斯泰尔·贝尔编辑

item.title: 波音股价因中国可能解除 737 订单冻结、迪拜订单激增而上涨
item.description:
Shares of Boeing (BA.N) rose on Monday after a report said China was considering ending its freeze on purchases of the planemaker's best-selling 737 MAX aircraft after more than four years.翻译:波音公司(BA.N)股价周一上涨，此前有报道称，中国正在考虑结束四年多以来对该飞机制造商最畅销 737 MAX 飞机的采购冻结。

This, coupled with bumper jet orders from Middle Eastern airlines at the Dubai Airshow, sent Boeing shares up 4%. Supplier Spirit Aerosystems (SPR.N) also rose 2.7%.翻译:再加上中东航空公司在迪拜航展上获得大量飞机订单，波音股价上涨 4%。供应商 Spirit Aerosystems (SPR.N)也上涨 2.7%。

China is considering resuming purchases of Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft when the U.S. and Chinese presidents meet this week at the APEC summit, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.翻译:彭博新闻周日援引知情人士的话报道称，中国正在考虑在美国和中国国家元首本周在亚太经合组织峰会上会晤时恢复购买波音 737 MAX 飞机。

The resumption of 737 orders from China would be meaningful to Boeing's bottom line over the next six to 18 months, said Thomas Hayes, chairman of hedge fund Great Hill Capital.翻译:对冲基金 Great Hill Capital 董事长托马斯·海耶斯 (Thomas Hayes) 表示，中国恢复 737 订单将对波音未来 6 至 18 个月的盈利产生重大影响。

Deliveries of Boeing's bestselling 737 MAX to Chinese airlines were halted following two deadly crashes.翻译:在发生两起致命空难后，波音最畅销的 737 MAX 飞机已停止向中国航空公司交付。

Boeing also secured orders for 125 widebody jets worth more than $50 billion from Emirates and its sister airline flydubai at the opening of the Dubai Airshow on Monday.翻译:波音公司还在周一迪拜航展开幕式上从阿联酋航空及其姊妹航空公司迪拜航空获得了价值超过 500 亿美元的 125 架宽体飞机订单。

Demand for the industry's biggest jets that dominated the region's airports is humming after a prolonged cyclical downturn followed by the damaging effect of COVID-19 on long-haul travel.翻译:在经历了长期的周期性低迷以及新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 对长途旅行的破坏性影响之后，对该地区机场主导的业界最大喷气式飞机的需求正在蓬勃发展。

Carriers have been placing orders with urgency as planemakers' backlogs have grown and as jet deliveries have been pushed out toward the end of the decade.翻译:由于飞机制造商的积压订单不断增加，而且喷气式飞机的交付时间被推迟到本世纪末，航空公司一直在紧急下订单。

"Potential reopening of the 737 in China for Boeing and the contracts at the Dubai Airshow is all kind of the perfect combination of optimism and positive outlook that the stock has been needing for many months where it has underperformed," Hayes added.翻译:海耶斯补充道：“波音公司在中国重新开放 737 飞机的可能性以及迪拜航展上的合同都是乐观情绪和积极前景的完美结合，而这正是该股几个月来表现不佳所需要的。”

Boeing shares were trading at $205.15, compared with analysts' current median price target of $250, according to LSEG data.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，波音股价目前交易价格为 205.15 美元，而分析师目前的目标中值目标价为 250 美元。

Reporting by Shivansh Tiwary and Ananya Mariam Rajesh in Bengaluru; Editing by Shilpi Majumdar翻译:Shivansh Tiwary 和 Ananya Mariam Rajesh 在班加罗尔的报道；希尔皮·马宗达尔编辑

item.title: 参议员要求财政部禁止中国电池公司和矿产参与美国电动汽车税收抵免
item.description:
Democratic Senator Joe Manchin urged the U.S. Treasury on Monday to adopt the "strictest possible standards" to prevent Chinese-produced minerals or Chinese battery companies from winning electric vehicle tax credits.翻译:民主党参议员乔·曼钦周一敦促美国财政部采取“尽可能严格的标准”，以阻止中国生产的矿物或中国电池公司获得电动汽车税收抵免。

Manchin, who chairs the Senate Energy Committee, raised concerns about reports Chinese battery companies are actively pursuing business opportunities to take advantage of the credits, adding U.S. tax credits "cannot be allowed to be hijacked by adversaries engaging in mineral laundering."翻译:参议院能源委员会主席曼钦对有报道称中国电池公司正在积极寻求商机以利用这些税收抵免表示担忧，并补充说美国税收抵免“不能被从事洗矿活动的对手劫持”。

Reporting by David Shepardson Editing by Chris Reese翻译:大卫·谢泼德森报道 克里斯·里斯编辑

item.title: 甘表示，中国工商银行因黑客扰乱美国国债市场而支付了赎金
item.description:
China's biggest lender, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, paid a ransom after it was hacked last week, a Lockbit ransomware gang representative said on Monday in a statement which Reuters was unable to independently verify.翻译:Lockbit 勒索软件团伙代表周一在一份声明中表示，中国最大的银行中国工商银行在上周遭到黑客攻击后支付了赎金，但路透社无法独立核实该声明。

ICBC, whose U.S. arm was hit by a ransomware attack that disrupted trades in the U.S. Treasury market on Nov. 9, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:11月9日，中国工商银行美国分行遭受勒索软件攻击，美国国债市场交易中断，该行没有立即回应置评请求。

"They paid a ransom, deal closed," the Lockbit representative told Reuters via Tox, an online messaging app.翻译:Lockbit 代表通过在线消息应用程序 Tox 告诉路透社：“他们支付了赎金，交易完成。”

The blackout at ICBC's U.S. broker-dealer left it temporarily owing BNY Mellon BK.N $9 billion, an amount many times larger than its net capital.翻译:工商银行美国经纪自营商停电使其暂时欠纽约梅隆银行 (BK.N) 90 亿美元，这一数额是其净资本的数倍。

The hack was so extensive that even corporate email at the firm ceased to function, forcing employees to switch to Google mail, Reuters reported.翻译:据路透社报道，这次黑客攻击的范围如此之大，以至于该公司的企业电子邮件都停止运行，迫使员工改用谷歌邮件。

"The market is mostly back to normal now," said Zhiwei Ren, a portfolio manager at Penn Mutual Asset Management.翻译:佩恩互惠资产管理公司投资组合经理任志伟表示：“市场现在基本恢复正常。”

The ransomware attack came at a time of heightened worries about the resiliency of the $26 trillion Treasury market, essential to the plumbing of global finance, and is likely to draw scrutiny from regulators.翻译:此次勒索软件攻击发生之际，人们对 26 万亿美元的国债市场的弹性更加担忧，该市场对于全球金融管道至关重要，并且可能会引起监管机构的审查。

A spokesperson for the U.S. Treasury Department did not immediately provide comment on Monday.翻译:美国财政部发言人周一没有立即发表评论。

The Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center, a financial industry cybersecurity group, said financial firms have well-established protocols for sharing information on such incidents.翻译:金融业网络安全组织金融服务信息共享和分析中心表示，金融公司拥有完善的协议来共享此类事件的信息。

"We are reminding members to stay current on all protective measures and patch critical vulnerabilities immediately," a spokesperson said in a statement, adding: "Ransomware remains one of the top threat vectors facing the financial sector."

WHY PAY?

Lockbit has hacked some of the world's largest organisations in recent months, stealing and leaking sensitive data in cases where victims refused to pay ransom.翻译:近几个月来，Lockbit 对世界上一些最大的组织进行了黑客攻击，在受害者拒绝支付赎金的情况下窃取和泄露敏感数据。

In just three years, it has become the world's top ransomware threat, according to U.S. officials.翻译:据美国官员称，在短短三年内，它已成为全球最大的勒索软件威胁。

Nowhere has it been more disruptive than in the United States, hitting more than 1,700 American organisations in nearly every sector from financial services and food to schools, transportation and government departments.翻译:没有哪个地方比美国更具破坏性，影响了从金融服务、食品到学校、交通和政府部门等几乎各个领域的 1,700 多个美国组织。

Authorities have long advised against paying ransomware gangs in a bid to break the criminals' business model. Ransom is usually demanded in the form of cryptocurrency, which is harder to trace and gives the receiver anonymity.翻译:当局长期以来一直建议不要向勒索软件团伙支付费用，以打破犯罪分子的商业模式。赎金通常以加密货币的形式提出，这种形式更难以追踪，并且可以让接收者匿名。

Some companies have quietly paid up in a bid to get back online quickly and avoid the reputational damage of having their sensitive data publicly leaked. Victims who do not have digital backups that allow them to restore their systems without the need of a decryption key sometimes have no choice but to pay.翻译:一些公司已经悄悄付款，以求尽快恢复正常运营，并避免因敏感数据公开泄露而造成声誉受损。没有数字备份而无需解密密钥即可恢复系统的受害者有时别无选择，只能付费。

Last week, Lockbit hackers published internal data from aerospace giant Boeing BA.N and said on their website they had infected computer systems at law firm Allen & Overy.翻译:上周，Lockbit 黑客公布了航空航天巨头波音 BA.N 的内部数据，并 在其网站上表示，他们已经感染了 Allen & Overy 律师事务所的计算机系统。

Reporting by James Pearson in London; Additional reporting by Davide Barbuscia, Carolina Mandl and Tatiana Bautzer in New York, and Pete Schroeder in Washington DC; Editing by Michelle Price, David Goodman, Jonathan Oatis and Alexander Smith翻译:詹姆斯·皮尔森在伦敦的报道； Davide Barbuscia、Carolina Mandl 和 Tatiana Bautzer 在纽约以及 Pete Schroeder 在华盛顿特区的补充报道；编辑：米歇尔·普莱斯、大卫·古德曼、乔纳森·奥蒂斯和亚历山大·史密斯

item.title: 欧盟同意在与中国和美国的竞争中确保关键原材料的规则
item.description:
EU countries and lawmakers at the European Parliament on Monday clinched a deal on rules to secure the bloc's supply of critical raw materials ranging from aluminium to lithium, amid a race with the U.S. and China.翻译:欧盟国家和欧洲议会议员周一在与美国和中国的竞争中就确保欧盟从铝到锂等关键原材料的供应的规则达成协议。

The European Commission proposed the Critical Raw Materials Act in March to ensure the EU's access to a secure, affordable and sustainable supply of raw materials crucial to the digital industry, aerospace and defence sectors, and the green energy push.翻译:欧盟委员会于三月份提出了《关键原材料法案》，以确保欧盟能够获得安全、负担得起和可持续的原材料供应，这对数字工业、航空航天和国防部门以及绿色能源发展至关重要。

The draft rules needed to be thrashed out with EU countries and lawmakers before they could become legislation. Both sides agreed the final details on Monday, Spain, which currently holds the rotating EU presidency, said on social media platform X.翻译:规则草案需要与欧盟国家和立法者共同讨论，然后才能成为立法。目前担任欧盟轮值主席国的西班牙在社交媒体平台 X 上表示，双方周一就最终细节达成一致。

The agreed rules set targets for the region to mine 10% of the critical raw materials it consumes, such as lithium, and for the first time copper and nickel, with recycling adding a further 25%.翻译:商定的规则设定了该地区消耗的关键原材料（例如锂）的 10% 的目标，并首次开采铜和镍，并进一步增加 25% 的回收利用。

They also set out a list of 34 critical raw materials and 17 strategic raw materials.翻译:他们还列出了34种关键原材料和17种战略原材料的清单。

Large companies exposed to shortages of strategic raw materials in strategic technologies, such as battery manufacturers, hydrogen producers and renewable energy generators, will be required to do a regular risk assessment of their supply chain of critical raw materials.翻译:面临战略技术领域战略原材料短缺的大公司，例如电池制造商、氢气生产商和可再生能源发电商，将被要求对其关键原材料供应链进行定期风险评估。

The EU is currently heavily reliant on China for rare earths and lithium, which are vital materials for the green transition.翻译:欧盟目前严重依赖中国的稀土和锂，这是绿色转型的重要材料。

EU industry chief Thierry Breton said in a statement that without action, Europe risked supply shortages and unwanted dependencies.翻译:欧盟工业负责人蒂埃里·布雷顿(Thierry Breton)在一份声明中表示，如果不采取行动，欧洲将面临供应短缺和不必要的依赖的风险。

"With this new law, we are increasing our extracting, processing, refining and recycling capacities in Europe with the highest environmental and social standards," he said.翻译:他说：“通过这项新法律，我们正在欧洲以最高的环境和社会标准提高我们的提取、加工、精炼和回收能力。”

The bloc will work with member states to identify strategic projects that will benefit from shorter and more efficient permitting procedures and easier access to finance, he added.翻译:他补充说，欧盟将与成员国合作，确定战略项目，这些项目将受益于更短、更高效的许可程序和更容易获得融资。

Member states will have the possibility to object on whether a project will be developed within their borders.翻译:成员国将有可能对是否在其境内开发项目提出反对。

Reporting by Foo Yun Chee; Editing by David Goodman and Jan Harvey翻译:符润芝报道；大卫·古德曼和简·哈维编辑

item.title: 由于通胀和利率担忧重新席卷市场，全球股市持平
item.description:
Global stocks traded in a narrow range on Monday as the market focused on U.S. inflation data for more clues on whether global interest rates really have peaked.翻译:周一全球股市窄幅波动，市场关注美国通胀数据，以寻找更多关于全球利率是否真正见顶的线索。

After two weeks of gains, MSCI's gauge of global equities (.MIWD00000PUS) whipsawed between modest gains and losses, and was up 0.24% at noon. Wall Street's benchmark S&P 500 share index (.SPX) was flat, the Dow Jones Industrial Index (.DJI) was up 0.28%, while the Nasdaq Composite lost 0.19%.翻译:经过两周的上涨后，MSCI 全球股市指数(.MIWD00000PUS)在温和上涨和下跌之间摇摆，中午上涨 0.24%。华尔街基准标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)持平，道琼斯工业指数(.DJI)上涨 0.28%，而纳斯达克综合指数下跌 0.19%。

The index for world equities has gained almost 5% so far this month, after risk aversion in October caused by the Israel-Hamas war was soothed by bets that major central banks have ended their lengthy run of interest rate hikes.翻译:10月份以色列-哈马斯战争引发的避险情绪因主要央行已结束长期加息的押注而得到缓解，本月迄今为止，世界股市指数已上涨近5%。

Still, the week ahead is packed with market risk events, with consumer inflation and retail sales figures from the United States on Tuesday and Wednesday, respectively, the most likely to shift the economic narrative.翻译:尽管如此，未来一周仍将充满市场风险事件，美国周二和周三分别公布的消费者通胀和零售销售数据最有可能改变经济形势。

"Top of mind this week will be Tuesday's October Consumer Price Index report where we are looking for core inflation to have gained additional speed for a third straight month," analysts at TD Securities said in a note. They forecast core inflation to have accelerated to 0.4% from 0.3% in September.翻译:道明证券分析师在一份报告中表示：“本周最重要的是周二公布的十月消费者价格指数报告，我们预计核心通胀将连续第三个月加速增长。”他们预测核心通胀率将从 9 月份的 0.3% 加速至 0.4%。

Economists polled by Reuters expect headline U.S. consumer price inflation slowed to 3.3% in October from 3.7% the month before, with the so-called core inflation rate that strips out volatile components unchanged.翻译:路透社调查的经济学家预计，10 月份美国总体消费者价格通胀率将从上月的 3.7% 放缓至 3.3%，剔除波动性成分的所谓核心通胀率保持不变。

"While a continuation of the (stocks) rally into year-end is definitely possible, it may be muted by bearish equity sentiment driven by both heightened geopolitical and financial market risk," research house BCA also cautioned in a note to clients on Monday.翻译:研究机构 BCA 在周一给客户的一份报告中也警告说：“虽然（股市）涨势肯定有可能持续到年底，但地缘政治和金融市场风险加剧所驱动的看跌股市情绪可能会削弱这种涨势。”

That combination of rate hike worries and risk aversion helped send the dollar to a fresh one-year high against the yen on Monday.翻译:加息担忧和避险情绪结合在一起，推动美元兑日元周一创下一年新高。

Benchmark 10-year Treasury yields , which rise when prices fall, also touched a one-week high of 4.6960% early Monday, as concerns about inflation reduced the appeal of fixed interest-paying debt instruments.翻译:随着价格下跌而上涨的基准10年期国债收益率周一早些时候也触及一周高点4.6960%，原因是对通胀的担忧降低了固定付息债务工具的吸引力。

The dollar hit 151.90 yen on Monday for the first time since mid-October last year, and was still hovering at 151.565 near those highs at 1536 GMT. The dollar index, which tracks the U.S. currency against six others, was flat at 105.61, within distance of its year-to-date high reached Oct. 3.翻译:周一，美元兑日元汇率自去年10月中旬以来首次触及151.90日元，且仍徘徊在151.565日元附近，格林威治标准时间1536年的高点附近。追踪美元兑其他六种货币的美元指数持平于 105.61，距离 10 月 3 日触及的今年迄今高点不远。

Nomura Securities strategist Naka Matsuzawa said global equities were now likely close to a peak.翻译:野村证券(Nomura Securities)策略师Naka Matsuzawa表示，全球股市目前可能已接近峰值。

"Up until now, the market has been taking bad economic news as good news, because that would mean a pause in Fed rate hikes," he said.翻译:“到目前为止，市场一直将坏经济消息视为好消息，因为这将意味着美联储加息的暂停，”他表示。

"But now, the Treasury market has already priced in a pause, so there's not much room for Treasury yields to fall further," removing a support for the stock market. "In short, I don't think the stock market rally is going to continue."翻译:“但现在，国债市场已经消化了暂停的定价，因此国债收益率进一步下跌的空间不大，”这消除了对股市的支撑。 “简而言之，我认为股市上涨不会持续。”

Adding to short-term market tensions, U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping will meet this week on the sidelines of an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国领导人习近平将于本周在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间会面，这加剧了短期市场的紧张局势。

Crude oil prices also eased as demand worries trumped supply concerns ahead of Chinese retail sales data later in the week that may darken an outlook already dimmed by declining industrial activity in the world's second-largest economy.翻译:原油价格也有所回落，因为在本周晚些时候中国零售销售数据公布之前，需求担忧超过了供应担忧，这可能使已经因全球第二大经济体工业活动下降而黯淡的前景变得更加黯淡。

Brent crude futures for January and U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures for December edged higher, both up around $1.30 at $82.72 and $78.44 a barrel.翻译:1 月布伦特原油期货和 12 月美国西德克萨斯中质原油 (WTI) 原油期货小幅走高，均上涨约 1.30 美元，至每桶 82.72 美元和 78.44 美元。

Both benchmarks gained nearly 2% on Friday as Iraq voiced support for oil cuts by OPEC+.翻译:由于伊拉克表示支持 OPEC+ 减产，两个基准周五均上涨近 2%。

item.title: 美国表示正在努力在APEC领导人宣言上达成强有力的共识
item.description:
The United States is working hard to try to get a strong consensus leaders' statement at this week's Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum (APEC) summit this week, the senior U.S. official for APEC, Matt Murray, told reporters on Monday.翻译:美国亚太经合组织高级官员马特·默里周一对记者表示，美国正在努力争取在本周举行的亚太经济合作论坛（APEC）峰会上达成强有力的共识领导人声明。

Leaders from the 21-member APEC forum are due to gather in San Francisco from Wednesday until Friday. The wars in the Middle East and Ukraine have divided opinion among APEC members, making drafting a summit declaration difficult.翻译:由 21 个成员组成的 APEC 论坛领导人将于周三至周五齐聚旧金山。中东和乌克兰战争导致APEC成员意见分歧，给峰会宣言的起草带来困难。

"We're certainly working toward having a strong consensus statement in APEC for the leaders to be able to release at the end of the week," Murray said in a briefing call, while acknowledging there had been "a lot of friction over the last couple of years over statements, primarily due to the Russia-Ukraine conflict."翻译:默里在一次新闻发布会上表示：“我们当然正在努力在亚太经合组织会议上达成强有力的共识声明，以便领导人能够在本周末发布。”他同时承认“过去一段时间存在很多摩擦”。多年来的声明，主要是由于俄罗斯和乌克兰的冲突。”

"But last year Thailand hosted APEC and was able to announce a consensus leaders’ declaration, and we certainly want to try to do the same thing this year," Murray said.翻译:“但去年泰国主办了亚太经合组织，并能够宣布领导人共识宣言，我们当然希望今年尝试做同样的事情，”穆雷说。

"And we're working very hard with all of our like-minded partners and economies, economic partners throughout APEC, to try to deliver that kind of result."翻译:“我们正在与所有志同道合的伙伴和经济体、整个亚太经合组织的经济伙伴努力合作，努力实现这样的结果。”

Russia is a member of APEC and last year in Bangkok leaders endorsed a text vowing to uphold and strengthen a rules-based multilateral trading system while noting "most" of them condemned Russia's war in Ukraine.翻译:俄罗斯是亚太经合组织成员，去年领导人在曼谷签署了一份文本，誓言维护和加强基于规则的多边贸易体系，同时指出“大多数”领导人谴责俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争。

This year the war in the Middle East is an added complication with Muslim majority APEC members Indonesia and Malaysia, for example, backing the Palestinian cause, while the United States and others lean toward Israel.翻译:今年的中东战争变得更加复杂，例如，穆斯林占多数的亚太经合组织成员国印度尼西亚和马来西亚支持巴勒斯坦事业，而美国和其他国家则倾向于以色列。

The United State as host is in charge of the APEC guest list and says Russian President Vladimir Putin will not be attending the San Francisco summit. Murray said Russia would be represented by a deputy prime minister and other officials not subject to U.S. sanctions.翻译:美国作为东道主负责亚太经合组织嘉宾名单，并表示俄罗斯总统普京将不会出席旧金山峰会。默里表示，俄罗斯将由一名副总理和其他不受美国制裁的官员代表。

APEC accounts for about 62% of global GDP and almost half of global trade. It is unique in grouping economies rather than nations, allowing participation of Chinese-ruled Hong Kong and democratically governed Taiwan, which China claims as its own. It does not, however, include India, the world's most populous country.翻译:APEC约占全球GDP的62%，几乎占全球贸易的一半。它的独特之处在于将经济体而不是国家分组，允许中国统治的香港和民主统治的台湾参与其中，中国声称台湾是自己的领土。然而，它不包括世界上人口最多的国家印度。

Murray said India would be represented at ministerial-level APEC meetings this week as a "guest economy."翻译:穆雷表示，印度将作为“客座经济体”出席本周的亚太经合组织部长级会议。

Reporting by David Brunnstrom and Simon Lewis; editing by Jonathan Oatis翻译:大卫·布伦斯特罗姆和西蒙·刘易斯报道；乔纳森·奥蒂斯编辑
item.author: David Brunnstrom, Simon Lewis

item.title: 拜登将在习近平峰会前会见印度尼西亚总统
item.description:
Leaders from the United States and the Southeast Asian country of Indonesia will meet on Monday for talks that will set the stage for U.S. President Joe Biden's first face-to-face meeting in a year with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.翻译:美国和东南亚国家印度尼西亚领导人将于周一举行会谈，这将为美国总统乔·拜登与中国领导人习近平一年内的首次面对面会晤奠定基础。

Biden will host Indonesian President Joko Widodo at the White House as the two leaders prepare for a Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco, where Washington hopes to ease tensions with Beijing.翻译:拜登将在白宫接待印度尼西亚总统佐科·维多多，两国领导人正在筹备在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会，华盛顿希望在该峰会上缓解与北京的紧张关系。

Biden and Widodo are expected to agree to new cooperation in defense areas including cybersecurity, space, combined exercises and nuclear threats, according to a senior Biden administration official who declined to be named.翻译:一位不愿透露姓名的拜登政府高级官员表示，拜登和维多多预计将同意在网络安全、太空、联合演习和核威胁等国防领域开展新的合作。

On climate, the United States will announce steps with Indonesia on carbon capture and storage, supporting the electrical grid and improving air quality.翻译:在气候方面，美国将宣布与印度尼西亚在碳捕获和储存、支持电网和改善空气质量方面采取的措施。

Reuters reported on Sunday that the two countries are working to advance a potential minerals partnership focused on the electric vehicle (EV) battery metal nickel, citing three people with direct knowledge of the conversations.翻译:路透社周日援引三名直接了解对话情况的人士的话报道称，两国正在努力推进潜在的矿物合作伙伴关系，重点关注电动汽车（EV）电池金属镍。

But the Biden administration is still concerned about environmental, social and governance standards in Indonesia and is examining how such a deal might work. The two sides will unveil a plan that will prepare the countries for negotiations on the issue, said one of the U.S. officials.翻译:但拜登政府仍然对印度尼西亚的环境、社会和治理标准感到担忧，并正在研究这样的协议如何运作。一位美国官员表示，双方将公布一项计划，为两国就此问题的谈判做好准备。

Jokowi, as the president is known, is also expected to press Biden on steps to end Israel's war with Hamas.翻译:预计佐科威总统还将向拜登施压，要求其采取措施结束以色列与哈马斯的战争。

Indonesia, an archipelago of 270 million people, is the largest Muslim-majority nation. Many Muslims have been outraged by Biden's support for Israel after Hamas militants killed about 1,200 people and took more than 200 hostages on Oct. 7, according to Israeli officials. Palestinian officials have said Israeli strikes have killed more than 11,000 Gaza residents.翻译:印度尼西亚是一个拥有 2.7 亿人口的群岛国家，是最大的穆斯林占多数的国家。据以色列官员称，哈马斯武装分子于 10 月 7 日杀害了约 1,200 人并劫持了 200 多人质，之后许多穆斯林对拜登对以色列的支持感到愤怒。巴勒斯坦官员表示，以色列的空袭已造成超过 11,000 名加沙居民死亡。

"The president will look to ask Indonesia to a play a larger role and to assist us," in the Middle East, the U.S. official said, without elaborating on what such an expanded role might entail.翻译:这位美国官员表示，“总统将要求印度尼西亚在中东发挥更大的作用并协助我们”，但没有详细说明这种扩大的作用可能意味着什么。

Like several of its neighbors in Southeast Asia, Indonesia is economically intertwined with China as it navigates territorial disputes with its larger neighbor and wants to avoid getting caught in the middle by hostile Washington-Beijing relations. Biden is due to meet Xi on Wednesday.翻译:与东南亚的几个邻国一样，印度尼西亚在处理与其较大邻国的领土争端时与中国在经济上紧密相连，并希望避免因华盛顿与北京的敌对关系而陷入困境。拜登定于周三与习近平会面。

At the meeting, Jakarta is expected to formally upgrade relations with Washington to the highest diplomatic tier. Biden will also announce new funding for Indonesia's semiconductor industry, the people said.翻译:预计雅加达将在此次会议上正式将与华盛顿的关系提升至最高外交级别。知情人士称，拜登还将宣布为印度尼西亚半导体行业提供新的资金。

The two leaders will also discuss Indonesia's diplomatic efforts to resolve the conflict in neighboring Myanmar, where the military took control in a 2021 coup and has been engaged in clashes with rebel alliances, one of the officials said.翻译:一位官员表示，两位领导人还将讨论印度尼西亚为解决邻国缅甸冲突而做出的外交努力。缅甸军方在 2021 年的政变中控制了缅甸，并一直与叛军联盟发生冲突。

"It's going to be time soon for us to think about what our next steps are together to deal with a situation that is untenable," the person said.翻译:这位人士表示：“我们很快就会考虑下一步应该采取什么措施来应对这种难以维持的局面。”

Jokowi, first elected in 2014, is constitutionally required to leave office next year after serving the maximum two terms.翻译:佐科维于 2014 年首次当选，根据宪法规定，他必须在任期最多两届后于明年离任。

Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt; Editing by Michael Perry翻译:特雷弗·亨尼卡特报道；迈克尔·佩里编辑
item.author: Trevor Hunnicutt

item.title: 英国审查对外国收购的审查
item.description:
Britain is reviewing how it screens foreign takeovers for national security concerns to reduce the burden on businesses, less than two years after tougher rules were introduced, deputy prime minister Oliver Dowden said on Monday.翻译:英国副首相奥利弗·道登周一表示，在出台更严格的规定不到两年后，英国正在审查如何出于国家安全考虑筛选外国收购，以减轻企业负担。

The government, under the 2022 National Security and Investment Act, has the power to scrutinise investment and take action to protect assets that are vital to Britain's national security.翻译:根据《2022 年国家安全和投资法案》，政府有权审查投资并采取行动保护对英国国家安全至关重要的资产。

Companies, however, have criticised the breadth of the act, which requires the notification of deals in 17 areas, ranging from advanced materials to transport.翻译:然而，公司批评了该法案的广度，该法案要求通报从先进材料到运输等 17 个领域的交易。

In the first full year of the act coming into effect, China-linked takeovers accounted for eight of the 15 interventions made, prompting criticism from the Chinese embassy in London.翻译:该法案生效的第一年，15 项干预措施中， 有8 项是与中国相关的收购，这引发了中国驻伦敦大使馆的批评。

Notably, the law was used to force Chinese-owned technology company Nexperia to sell Britain's biggest microchip factory, Newport Wafer Fab, which it had bought in 2021.翻译:值得注意的是，该法律被用来迫使中国科技公司 Nexperia 出售其于 2021 年收购的英国最大的微芯片工厂 Newport Wafer Fab。

Dowden said he needed to ensure the screening powers remained "up to date, proportionate and transparent", while protecting national security.翻译:道登表示，他需要确保筛查权力保持“最新、适当和透明”，同时保护国家安全。

Semiconductors and critical minerals could be carved out as standalone sectors under the act, he said, reflecting their growing importance.翻译:他说，根据该法案，半导体和关键矿物可以被划分为独立的部门，这反映出它们日益增长的重要性。

He said businesses, investors and advisors would now be consulted to ensure the process remained as frictionless and effective as possible.翻译:他表示，现在将咨询企业、投资者和顾问，以确保这一过程尽可能保持无摩擦和有效。

Evidence can be submitted to the government until Jan. 15.翻译:证据可以在 1 月 15 日之前提交给政府。

"The best way to foster economic security is through a strong and open economy," Dowden said. "That's why we've been using the powers effectively so far, only intervening when absolutely necessary to protect national security."翻译:道登说：“促进经济安全的最佳途径是通过强大和开放的经济。” “这就是为什么我们迄今为止一直有效地使用这些权力，只有在绝对必要时才进行干预以保护国家安全。”

Reporting by Paul Sandle; Editing by Susan Fenton翻译:保罗·桑德尔报道；苏珊·芬顿编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 由于消费者等待价格实惠的电动汽车，欧洲的电动汽车需求放缓
item.description:
After years of accelerating growth, Europe's electric car sales appear to be entering a go-slow zone as drivers wait for better, cheaper models that are two to three years down the road.翻译:经过多年的加速增长，欧洲的电动汽车销售似乎正在进入一个缓慢的区域，因为驾驶者等待两到三年后更好、更便宜的车型。

Fully-electric sales in Europe were up 47% in the first nine months of 2023, but instead of celebrating, automakers including Tesla (TSLA.O), Volkswagen (VOWG_p.DE) and Mercedes-Benz (MBGn.DE) sounded a sombre note.翻译:2023 年前 9 个月，欧洲的纯电动汽车销量增长了 47%，但特斯拉(TSLA.O) 、 大众(VOWG_p.DE)和梅赛德斯-奔驰(MBGn.DE)等汽车制造商非但没有庆祝，反而表现出忧郁的态度。笔记。

High interest rates and a subdued market are putting customers off, they warned, with Volkswagen's EV order intake half what it was last year.翻译:他们警告说，高利率和低迷的市场正在让客户望而却步，大众汽车的电动汽车订单量仅为去年的一半。

Dealers in Germany and Italy as well as research by four global data analysis firms say there is more behind the slower uptake than economic uncertainty, with the consumers unconvinced that EVs meet their safety, range and price needs.翻译:德国和意大利的经销商以及四家全球数据分析公司的研究表示，电动汽车普及速度放缓的原因不仅仅是经济不确定性，消费者不相信电动汽车能够满足他们的安全性、续航里程和价格需求。

"The main problem is uncertainty," said Thomas Niedermayer, head of a 45-year-old family-owned Bavarian car dealership.翻译:“主要问题是不确定性，”巴伐利亚一家拥有 45 年历史的家族汽车经销商的负责人托马斯·尼德迈尔 (Thomas Niedermayer) 表示。

"Many assume that the technology will improve and would rather wait three years for the next model than buy a vehicle now that will quickly lose value."翻译:“许多人认为技术会进步，宁愿等三年才能推出下一款车型，也不愿现在购买一辆很快就会贬值的汽车。”

Take Flavia Garcia and Tom Carvell in Edinburgh, Scotland.翻译:以苏格兰爱丁堡的弗拉维亚·加西亚和汤姆·卡维尔为例。

Their 15-year-old hand-me-down Toyota Auris, nicknamed Martina, needs replacing. With a petrol and diesel car ban nearing, the couple would consider an EV, but are put off by a lack of charging infrastructure, battery life fears and price.翻译:他们的 15 年二手丰田 Auris（绰号为 Martina）需要更换。随着汽油和柴油汽车禁令的临近，这对夫妇本来会考虑购买电动汽车，但由于缺乏充电基础设施、电池寿命担忧和价格而推迟。

AutoTrader says new EVs in Britain are still on average 33% more expensive than fossil-fuel models.翻译:AutoTrader 表示，英国的新款电动汽车平均仍比化石燃料车型贵 33%。

And most new models in the pipeline targeting entry-level consumers will not hit the market before 2025 at the earliest – by which time they will be contending with an expanded Chinese line-up from BYD (002594.SZ) to Nio (9866.HK) in Europe.翻译:大多数针对入门级消费者的新车型最早不会在 2025 年之前上市，届时它们将与从比亚迪（002594.SZ）到蔚来汽车（9866.HK ）等不断扩大的中国产品阵容竞争。 ）在欧洲。

"You want to do the right thing for the environment, but it feels like you're setting yourself up for a very expensive investment that will make your life that bit more complicated," Garcia, a 29-year-old corporate media director, said.翻译:“你想为环境做正确的事，但感觉就像你在为自己做一项非常昂贵的投资，这会让你的生活变得更加复杂，”29 岁的企业媒体总监加西亚说，说。

"We'll probably get a hybrid first".

FALLING BEHIND

Critics have long warned that a lack of affordable EVs would eventually stall the steep sales growth boosted by early adopters and corporate fleets.翻译:批评者长期以来一直警告说，缺乏负担得起的电动汽车最终将阻碍早期采用者和企业车队推动的销量急剧增长。

A weaker performance in September, consumer sentiment surveys and bleak commentary from carmakers and dealers indicates that low growth era may have arrived.翻译:9月份的疲软表现、消费者信心调查以及汽车制造商和经销商的悲观评论表明低增长时代可能已经到来。

U.S. automakers, though further behind on the transition to EVs, are also feeling the pinch. Ford and GM warned recently they were delaying the launch of cheaper EV models and pulling back on spending due to weaker demand and higher costs in the wake of new United Auto Worker contracts.翻译:美国汽车制造商虽然在向电动汽车转型方面进一步落后，但也感受到了压力。 福特和通用汽车最近警告称，由于新的美国汽车工人联合会合同签订后需求疲软和成本上升，他们将推迟推出更便宜的电动汽车车型，并削减支出。

But the problem is cyclical.翻译:但问题是周期性的。

Demand will remain slow for as long as there are no cheaper EVs available, Felipe Munoz of JATO Dynamics said of the slowdown in sales in Europe in September.翻译:JATO Dynamics 的费利佩·穆尼奥斯 (Felipe Munoz) 在谈到 9 月份欧洲销售放缓时表示，只要没有更便宜的电动汽车，需求就会保持低迷。

"From a regulatory standpoint, they don't have to push product out right now - they can afford to focus on profitability," said Alistair Bedwell, head of powertrain forecasting at GlobalData (DATA.L).翻译:GlobalData (DATA.L)动力总成预测主管阿利斯泰尔·贝德韦尔 (Alistair Bedwell) 表示：“从监管的角度来看，他们不必立即推出产品，他们有能力专注于盈利能力。”

"But they need to have an eye on Tesla and the Chinese brands, because they don't want to get too far behind."翻译:“但他们需要关注特斯拉和中国品牌，因为他们不想落后太远。”

Intention to buy an EV has stayed constant in Germany over the past year, a poll by consumer research firm The Langston Co showed - meaning that although the number of EVs being sold is rising, the number of people wanting to buy an EV is not.翻译:消费者研究公司 The Langston Co 的一项民意调查显示，过去一年德国购买电动汽车的意愿保持不变，这意味着尽管电动汽车的销售数量在增加，但想要购买电动汽车的人数却没有增加。

Growing sales may simply be a sign that carmakers who were struggling to produce EVs because of supply chain bottlenecks can finally meet backed up orders, rather than a sign of rising demand, said The Langston Co's insights manager Ben DuCharme.翻译:Langston Co 的洞察经理 Ben DuCharme 表示，销量增长可能只是一个迹象，表明因供应链瓶颈而苦苦生产电动汽车的汽车制造商终于可以满足备份订单，而不是需求上升的迹象。

Philip Nothard, insight director at dealer services firm Cox Automotive, said low residual values also put buyers off as companies and many consumers choose new cars based on what they can sell them for a few years down the line.翻译:经销商服务公司 Cox Automotive 的洞察总监 Philip Nothard 表示，低残值也会让买家望而却步，因为公司和许多消费者会根据未来几年的销售能力来选择新车。

"We call it the valley of death, which we will be going through in 2024 to 2027: low residual values, high supply, and low demand," Nothard added.翻译:诺特哈德补充道：“我们将其称为死亡之谷，我们将在 2024 年至 2027 年经历这一过程：残值低、供应高、需求低。”

Reporting by Victoria Waldersee, Nick Carey; Additional reporting by Giulio Piovaccari in Rome, Paul Lienert in Detroit; Graphics by Sumanta Sen; Editing by Alexander Smith翻译:维多利亚·瓦尔德西、尼克·凯里报道； Giulio Piovaccari 在罗马、Paul Lienert 在底特律的补充报道；制图：Sumanta Sen；亚历山大·史密斯编辑

item.title: 托克将澳大利亚开采的铜带回中国——消息人士
item.description:
Summary:
  • Standard Australian copper concentrate shipment en route to China
  • Trafigura unit to assist with customs clearance
  • Entry of the cargo points to end of informal ban
翻译:概括：
  • 标准澳大利亚铜精矿运往中国
  • 托克部门协助清关
  • 货运点进入以结束非正式禁令

Swiss commodity trader Trafigura has agreed to help Chinese smelters clear imports of copper concentrate from Australia, suggesting an informal ban has been lifted if the cargo clears customs, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.翻译:三名知情人士告诉路透社，瑞士大宗商品贸易商托克已同意帮助中国冶炼厂清关从澳大利亚进口的铜精矿，这表明如果货物清关，非正式禁令将被解除。

China has gradually been easing a raft of unofficial curbs and tariffs on Australian imports, including copper concentrate and coal, that were imposed in 2020 at the height of a diplomatic spat over trade and security.翻译:中国正在逐步放松对澳大利亚进口商品（包括铜精矿和煤炭）的一系列非正式限制和关税，这些限制和关税是在 2020 年贸易和安全外交争端最严重时实施的。

Despite a wider informal easing, state-owned Chinese smelters that turn concentrate into copper metal, have been reluctant to buy from Australia, which accounted for 5%, or 1.1 million tonnes, of China's total copper concentrate imports in 2019.翻译:尽管有更广泛的非正式宽松政策，但将精矿转变成金属铜的中国国有冶炼厂一直不愿从澳大利亚购买，澳大利亚占2019年中国铜精矿进口总量的5%，即110万吨。

However a shipment of around 10,000 metric tonnes of copper concentrate mined from Western Australia's Golden Grove, owned by 29Metals (29M.AX), is on its way to Shandong province, where many major Chinese smelters are located, the sources said.翻译:然而，消息人士称，29Metals (29M.AX)旗下西澳大利亚 Golden Grove 开采的约 10,000 吨铜精矿正在运往中国许多主要冶炼厂所在地的山东省。

The passage of a large cargo of Australian concentrate through customs in China will ease smelters' concerns about a political backlash, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，大批澳大利亚精矿通过中国海关将缓解冶炼厂对政治反弹的担忧。

"We have been waiting for others to be the first to resume buying Australia-origin concentrate," a source at a major Chinese copper concentrates importer said.翻译:“我们一直在等待其他人率先恢复购买澳大利亚原产精矿，”中国一家主要铜精矿进口商的消息人士表示。

Copper is vital for the power industry due to its conductivity. China consumes nearly half of the global mined copper supply estimated at around 25 million tonnes this year.翻译:由于其导电性，铜对于电力工业至关重要。中国今年消耗了全球矿铜供应量的近一半，估计约为 2500 万吨。

Trafigura's Chinese affiliate will be responsible for clearing customs on behalf of domestic consumers once the cargo arrives at Shandong's Qingdao port, two of the sources said.翻译:两名消息人士称，一旦货物抵达山东青岛港，托克的中国子公司将负责代表国内消费者清关。

"Once Trafigura gets the clearance, it is official that the soft ban has come to an end," the source added.翻译:消息人士补充道：“一旦托克获得许可，软禁令就正式结束。”

Trafigura declined to comment. 29Metals did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:托克拒绝置评。 29Metals 没有回应置评请求。

Australian trade data shows exports worth A$60.5 million ($38.52 million) of copper ore and concentrate to China in January.翻译:澳大利亚贸易数据显示，1 月份向中国出口了价值6050 万澳元（合 3852 万美元）的铜矿石和精矿。

However, the cargo was not logged in Chinese data, which officially shows that in the first nine months of this year, only $10 worth of copper ore and concentrate were imported.翻译:然而，中国数据并未记录这批货物，官方数据显示，今年前9个月，仅进口了价值10美元的铜矿石和精矿。

Australia produced 818,800 tonnes of copper in ore and concentrates last year and is, according International Copper Study Group, the world's eighth-largest producer of the metal.翻译:据国际铜业研究组织称，澳大利亚去年以矿石和精矿的形式生产了 818,800 吨铜，是世界第八大金属生产国。

The shipments from Australia come at a critical time, when Chinese smelters are starting annual negotiations with major miners on annual treatment charges and refining charges (TC/RC).翻译:来自澳大利亚的发货正值关键时刻，当时中国冶炼厂正开始与主要矿商就年度处理费和精炼费（TC/RC）进行年度谈判。

TC/RC is the income received by smelters for turning concentrates into refined copper, which typically rises with higher supply and falls during times of shortages.翻译:TC/RC 是冶炼厂将精矿转化为精炼铜所获得的收入，通常随着供应量的增加而增加，并在短缺时减少。

($1 = 1.5706 Australian dollars)翻译:(1 美元 = 1.5706 澳元)

Reporting by Julian Luk; Editing by Veronica Brown and Sharon Singleton翻译:Julian Luk 报道；维罗妮卡·布朗和莎朗·辛格尔顿编辑

item.title: 卡梅伦重返英国政府，批评者称其绝望
item.description:
Seven years ago, David Cameron left Downing Street after his big gamble to hold a referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union backfired and brought his six-year term as prime minister to an end.翻译:七年前，戴维·卡梅伦就英国脱欧问题举行全民公投，结果适得其反，结束了他六年的首相任期，随后离开了唐宁街。

A few months later his political career appeared to be over as he resigned his seat in parliament, with opponents blaming him for the defeat in the referendum in which he had campaigned for "remain" and Brexit supporters saying he had failed to implement a proper strategy to prepare for departure.翻译:几个月后，他辞去了议会席位，政治生涯似乎结束了，反对者指责他在公投中失败，而他在公投中主张“留欧”，而英国脱欧支持者则表示他未能实施适当的策略准备出发。

News that he had been appointed foreign secretary by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday delighted the centrist wing of the ruling Conservative Party, who said Britain needed a big hitter on the global stage who would also prove an electoral asset.翻译:周一，他被首相里希·苏纳克任命为外交大臣的消息令执政保守党的中间派感到高兴，他们表示，英国需要一位在全球舞台上的重要人物，同时也将成为选举资产。

But for critics of Sunak, the appointment of someone whose policies he has criticised - and who in return has been dismissive of his own leadership - was a desperate act to resurrect his ailing government, languishing some 20 points behind in opinion polls with an election expected next year.翻译:但对于苏纳克的批评者来说，任命一个曾被他批评过政策的人——而这个人反过来又对他自己的领导不屑一顾——是一种绝望的行为，目的是复兴他陷入困境的政府，在预计举行选举的民意调查中落后约20个百分点明年。

"Though I may have disagreed with some individual decisions, it is clear to me that Rishi Sunak is a strong and capable prime minister, who is showing exemplary leadership at a difficult time," Cameron said in a statement after his appointment.翻译:卡梅伦在任命后的一份声明中表示：“尽管我可能不同意某些个人决定，但我很清楚苏纳克是一位坚强而有能力的首相，他在困难时期表现出了模范的领导能力。”

In the years since leaving office, much of the policy agenda Cameron pursued as prime minister has been ditched by his successors, particularly his charm offensive with China and unsuccessful attempts to court Russian President Vladimir Putin, making his comeback seem even more remarkable.

CHANGED TIMES

Cameron said he wanted to be China's closest friend in the West as he sought Chinese investment for British infrastructure, and stated that relations with Beijing were in a "golden era" in 2015, when President Xi Jinping made a state visit to Britain.翻译:卡梅伦表示，在寻求中国对英国基础设施的投资时，他希望成为中国在西方最亲密的朋友，并在2015年习近平主席对英国进行国事访问时表示，与北京的关系正处于“黄金时代”。

But last November, Sunak said in a major speech that the golden era was over "along with the naive idea that trade would lead to social and political reform", as London restricted Chinese investment over national security concerns and expressed concern at Beijing's military and economic assertiveness.翻译:但去年11月，苏纳克在一次重要演讲中表示，黄金时代已经结束，“伴随着贸易将带来社会和政治改革的天真想法”，伦敦出于国家安全考虑限制中国投资，并对北京的军事和经济表示担忧。自信。

Steve Tsang, director of the China Institute at SOAS University of London, told Reuters he did not expect the appointment to change British policy. "The 'golden era' remains in the history, and is not about to be resurrected," he said.翻译:伦敦大学亚非学院中国研究院院长曾锐生告诉路透社，他并不认为这一任命会改变英国的政策。 “‘黄金时代’只会留在历史中，不会复活，”他说。

Just a month ago, Sunak had completely distanced himself from Cameron's government, telling his party conference he was the man to change what he described as 30 years of an inefficient "political status quo".翻译:就在一个月前，苏纳克完全与卡梅伦政府保持距离，他在党内会议上表示，他是改变他所说的30年来低效“政治现状”的人。

That prompted Cameron himself to say the comments would fuel the view of opponents that his party could not think in the long term and that it was heading in the wrong direction.翻译:这促使卡梅伦本人表示，这些言论将加剧反对者的观点，即他的政党无法从长远考虑，而且正在走向错误的方向。

"David Cameron was a disastrous PM. This is a last gasp act of desperation from a government devoid of talent and ideas," said David Lammy, the foreign affairs spokesman for the main opposition Labour Party.

YOUNGEST PM IN TWO CENTURIES

Cameron became the country's youngest prime minister for almost two centuries in 2010, when he also headed the first coalition government since World War Two.翻译:2010年，卡梅伦成为该国近两个世纪以来最年轻的首相，当时他还领导了自第二次世界大战以来的第一个联合政府。

But, he alienated some on the party's right-wing, especially those who wanted Britain out of the EU, as he sought to modernise the Conservative's agenda by backing issues such as same-sex marriage and showing concern for the environment.翻译:但是，他疏远了党内的一些右翼人士，尤其是那些希望英国退出欧盟的人，因为他试图通过支持同性婚姻等问题和对环境的关注来实现保守党议程的现代化。

Centrist Conservative lawmakers believe Cameron will help the party win back voters who have been put off by its more populist recent right-wing turn.翻译:中间派保守党议员相信卡梅伦将帮助该党赢回因该党最近的民粹主义右翼转向而推迟的选民。

But Cameron also comes with baggage, not least the anger his appointment has prompted from those who backed Brexit.翻译:但卡梅伦也有自己的包袱，尤其是他的任命激起了那些支持英国退欧的人的愤怒。

In 2021, he was also criticised by a parliamentary committee after he lobbied ministers and senior officials on behalf of supply chain finance firm Greensill as it collapsed.翻译:2021年，在供应链金融公司Greensill倒闭时，他代表该公司游说部长和高级官员，之后他还受到了议会委员会的批评。

One former minister put the cost to taxpayers at least 1 billion pounds ($1.22 billion).翻译:一位前部长认为纳税人为此付出了至少 10 亿英镑（12.2 亿美元）的代价。

"David Cameron was at the heart of the biggest lobbying scandal of recent times," said the Liberal Democrat party's foreign affairs spokesperson Layla Moran.翻译:自由民主党外交事务发言人莱拉·莫兰表示：“大卫·卡梅伦是近来最大的游说丑闻的核心人物。”

As the son of a wealthy stockbroker who was educated at Britain's most exclusive private school, Eton College, he also is open to the same criticism of being out of touch with the public that is aimed at Sunak, who with his wife Akshata Murthy, are the richest couple to ever occupy Downing Street.翻译:作为一位富有的股票经纪人的儿子，他曾在英国最高级的私立学校伊顿公学接受过教育，他也容易受到针对苏纳克的与公众脱节的同样的批评。唐宁街有史以来最富有的夫妇。

"I understand there's a lot of baggage that comes with David Cameron," Conservative lawmaker Tobias Ellwood told Times Radio.翻译:“我知道大卫·卡梅伦背负着很多包袱，”保守党议员托比亚斯·埃尔伍德告诉时代广播电台。

His colleague Dehenna Davidson said Cameron's vision of the party was the very reason she was in parliament.翻译:他的同事德亨娜戴维森表示，卡梅伦对党的愿景正是她进入议会的原因。

Theresa May, who replaced Cameron as prime minister before being ousted herself amid a party rebellion over Brexit three years later, said his experience would be invaluable.翻译:特雷莎·梅接替卡梅伦担任英国首相，三年后因英国脱欧引发的党内叛乱而被赶下台，她表示，他的经验将是无价的。

"Looking forward to working together again!" she tweeted.翻译:“期待再次合作！”她发推文说。

($1 = 0.8166 pounds)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.8166 英镑）

item.title: 巴拿马法院可能撤销第一量子铜矿合同
item.description:
Panama's top court is likely to rule against Canadian miner First Quantum when it decides on the fate of a key copper mine contract in the coming weeks, a majority of lawyers in a Reuters survey said, citing precedent for a similar verdict.翻译:路透社调查中的大多数律师援引类似判决的先例表示，巴拿马最高法院在未来几周内就一项重要铜矿合同的命运做出决定时，可能会做出对加拿大矿业公司第一量子不利的裁决。

The court's nine judges are weighing whether to revoke First Quantum's contract for the Cobre Panama mine, a significant resource that contributes 5% to Panama's GDP and 1% to global copper production.翻译:法院的 9 名法官正在权衡是否撤销First Quantum 与 Cobre 巴拿马矿的合同，该矿是一种重要资源，对巴拿马 GDP 贡献 5%，对全球铜产量贡献 1%。

The contested contract, which was approved on Oct. 20, provides First Quantum a 20-year mining right with an option to extend for another 20 years, in return for $375 million in annual revenue to Panama.翻译:这份有争议的合同于 10 月 20 日获得批准，为 First Quantum 提供了 20 年的采矿权，并可选择再延长 20 年，以换取巴拿马年收入 3.75 亿美元。

However, the contract has faced numerous legal challenges due to protests that claim it favors the miner too much and allege corrupt practices in its approval. Such protests have escalated into an anti-government movement, resulting in two deaths.翻译:然而，由于抗议活动称该合同过于偏向矿商，并指控其批准过程中存在腐败行为，该合同面临着众多法律挑战。此类抗议活动已升级为反政府运动，导致两人死亡。

The miner's contract has snowballed into a lightning rod ahead of the May 2024 Panama election. Meanwhile, Standard & Poor's has revised Panama's economic outlook to negative from stable due to potential risks to investors' confidence.翻译:在 2024 年 5 月巴拿马大选之前，该矿工的合同已经像滚雪球一样滚滚而来，成为避雷针。与此同时，由于投资者信心面临潜在风险，标准普尔将巴拿马经济前景从稳定调整为负面。

The uncertainty has also wiped about C$8 billion ($5.80 billion) from First Quantum's market value. Amid the rout, China's Jiangxi Copper Co Ltd (600362.SS), First Quantum's biggest shareholder, last week raised its stake in the Canadian company to 18.5%.翻译:这种不确定性还使 First Quantum 的市值蒸发了约 80 亿加元（58 亿美元）。在股市大跌之际，第一量子最大股东中国江西铜业股份有限公司（600362.SS）上周将其在这家加拿大公司的持股比例提高至18.5%。

Two Panamanian prosecutors have deemed the contract unconstitutional after examining legal challenges submitted to the court.翻译:两名巴拿马检察官在审查提交给法院的法律质疑后认为该合同违宪。

However, Maritza Cedeno, the president of the country's bar association, noted that past rulings have deviated from the initial positions of these officials.翻译:然而，该国律师协会主席玛丽扎·塞德诺指出，过去的裁决偏离了这些官员最初的立场。

She declined to disclose her stance, saying the court should work without pressures.翻译:她拒绝透露自己的立场，称法院应该在没有压力的情况下运作。

Four out of the seven lawyers polled by Reuters predicted the top court will nullify the contract, possibly as soon as mid-December. Two others believe the court will uphold the contract, while one remains uncertain.翻译:路透社调查的 7 名律师中有 4 名预测最高法院将宣布该合同无效，最快可能在 12 月中旬。另外两人相信法院会维持该合同，但其中一人仍不确定。

"There is precedent...," said lawyer Ariel Corbetti, pointing out that the contract has similarities to the initial First Quantum deal, which was scrapped by the court in 2017.翻译:“这是有先例的……”律师 Ariel Corbetti 表示，他指出该合同与最初的 First Quantum 交易有相似之处，该交易于 2017 年被法院废除。

That contract was inherited by First Quantum in 2013 after it became the operator of the mine. However, Panama's top court in 2017 deemed unconstitutional the law under which First Quantum was operating the mine.翻译:2013 年，第一量子成为该矿的运营商后，该合同由第一量子继承。然而，巴拿马最高法院于 2017 年裁定第一量子运营该矿所依据的法律违宪。

The ruling was upheld in 2021, resulting in last month's fresh deal with the government.翻译:该裁决于 2021 年得到维持，导致上个月与政府达成了新协议。

A representative for Panama's top court declined to comment on the possible outcome, and directed Reuters to a statement saying resolving the challenges is the body's "number one priority."翻译:巴拿马最高法院的一名代表拒绝对可能的结果发表评论，并指示路透社发表一份声明，称解决挑战是该机构的“首要任务”。

First Quantum did not reply to a request for comment on the future of the contract pending court proceedings.

BAN ON NEW MINING LICENSES

Granting a concession requires a public tender, which did not happen with First Quantum, Corbetti said, adding that foreign state-owned entities cannot own mining resources, which he said happens in this case with China.翻译:科贝蒂表示，授予特许权需要进行公开招标，而第一量子并未发生这种情况，他补充说，外国国有实体不能拥有采矿资源，而他表示，在中国的情况下，这种情况发生了。

If the court deems the contract unconstitutional, Panama would be in a tricky spot, lawyers said, as the government on Nov. 3 signed a bill banning all new mining concessions and extensions. That would prevent the two parties from negotiating a new deal.翻译:律师表示，如果法院认为该合同违宪，巴拿马将陷入困境，因为政府于 11 月 3 日签署了一项法案，禁止所有新的采矿特许权和延期。这将阻止两党就新协议进行谈判。

Panama has issued seven orders to cancel mining concessions to abide by the new law, the trade ministry said last week, without providing detail.翻译:巴拿马贸易部上周表示，为了遵守新法律，巴拿马已发布七项取消采矿特许权的命令，但未提供细节。

Corbetti also said authorities should seek an agreement with the company for its exit to avoid international litigation.翻译:科尔贝蒂还表示，当局应寻求与该公司就退出达成协议，以避免国际诉讼。

Panama's mining chamber has urged against canceling the contract, saying First Quantum could sue Panama for at least $50 billion.翻译:巴拿马矿业商会敦促不要取消合同，称第一量子可能会起诉巴拿马，索赔至少 500 亿美元。

Another lawyer said the court could also move to declare parts of the contract unconstitutional, which would not annul it completely.翻译:另一位律师表示，法院还可以宣布该合同的部分内容违宪，但这不会完全废除该合同。

Others say the court will rule in First Quantum's favor.翻译:其他人则表示，法院将作出有利于第一量子的裁决。

"This conflict cannot be solved in a temperamental way," said lawyer Juan Carlos Arauz, former head of the country's bar association, adding he does not see a scenario under which the court would deem the miner's contract unconstitutional.翻译:该国律师协会前主席、律师胡安·卡洛斯·阿劳兹表示：“这场冲突不能以情绪化的方式解决。”他补充说，他不认为法院会认为矿工的合同违宪。

Arauz said revoking the contract would put Panama in a weak spot if the matter goes to international arbitration and could open leaders to litigation.翻译:阿劳兹表示，如果此事提交国际仲裁，撤销合同将使巴拿马处于弱势地位，并可能导致领导人面临诉讼。

Lawyer Victor Baker said proper consultations were conducted for the contract's approval and there was no need for a bidding process since the miner had existing operations, as he expressed confidence in a ruling favoring the company.翻译:律师维克多·贝克(Victor Baker)表示，合同的批准已经进行了适当的协商，由于该矿商已有业务，因此不需要招标程序，他对有利于该公司的裁决充满信心。

($1 = 1.3802 Canadian dollars)翻译:（1 美元 = 1.3802 加元）

item.title: 北美航空公司押注亚洲以提高利润
item.description:
The return of North American flights to Asia-Pacific is accelerating heading in to 2024, as carriers bet on the region as the next source of high-margin revenue at a time of soaring costs.翻译:到 2024 年，北美航班将加速重返亚太地区，航空公司押注该地区将成为成本飙升之际下一个高利润收入来源。

A rebound in Asia is especially important for airlines where long-haul travel makes up a bigger mix of revenue. Carriers tapped pent-up demand last summer with sky-high fares on flights to Europe, but a return of those prices may not be in the cards next year as capacity grows, some analysts said.翻译:亚洲的反弹对于航空公司来说尤其重要，因为长途旅行在收入中所占比例更大。一些分析师表示，去年夏天，航空公司利用飞往欧洲航班的天价票价来挖掘被压抑的需求，但随着运力的增长，明年这些价格可能不会恢复。

Business travel, a cash cow for airlines, is also rebounding in Asia. Travel spending in Asia Pacific is set to grow 41% this year to $567 billion, and rise to $800 billion by 2027, according to data from the Global Business Travel Association.翻译:商务旅行作为航空公司的摇钱树，在亚洲也出现反弹。全球商务旅行协会的数据显示，今年亚太地区的旅行支出预计将增长 41%，达到 5,670 亿美元，到 2027 年将增至 8,000 亿美元。

Air Canada's (AC.TO) estimated traffic to Asia would be "closer to 80-something percent" of 2019 levels next year, the carrier's vice president of network planning told Reuters. The planned capacity, which has not been previously reported, is a strong rebound from 2022, when the carrier's Asia-Pacific traffic was 33% of 2019 levels.翻译:加拿大航空(AC.TO)负责网络规划的副总裁告诉路透社，该公司预计明年飞往亚洲的客流量将“接近 2019 年水平的 80%”。此前未曾报道过的计划运力较 2022 年强劲反弹，当时该航空公司的亚太地区运力为 2019 年水平的 33%。

While United Airlines (UAL.O), American Airlines (AAL.O) and Delta Air Lines (DAL.N) are offering fewer seats to Asia Pacific in the current quarter compared with 2019, the numbers are up 75% on an annual basis, according to aviation analytics company Cirium.翻译:虽然联合航空(UAL.O) 、美国航空(AAL.O)和达美航空(DAL.N)本季度向亚太地区提供的座位数量较 2019 年有所减少，但该数字同比增长 75% ，根据航空分析公司 Cirium 的数据。

In the first three months of 2024, the numbers will be up about 79% year-on-year. In contrast, seats on the flights of the three U.S. carriers to Europe will grow an annual 6%.翻译:2024年前三个月，这一数字将同比增长约79%。相比之下，美国三大航空公司飞往欧洲的航班座位数将以每年6%的速度增长。

Travel to Asia is also a source of high-margin revenue at a time when soaring labor and fuel costs are pressuring profit and domestic fares are declining.翻译:在劳动力和燃料成本飙升给利润带来压力、国内票价不断下降的情况下，前往亚洲旅行也是高利润收入的一个来源。

"The market here in the United States is more mature," United's chief commercial officer, Andrew Nocella, said at a conference earlier this month. "The growth rates of 7% or 8% or 9% for the industry are just not going to be possible, but growing overseas, we think there's just a lot more opportunity."

SUPPLY-DEMAND MISMATCH

Asia-Pacific has lagged behind the U.S. and Europe in global travel demand recovery after the pandemic. While passenger traffic in the region has surged since the reopening of borders, international airline capacity remains below 2019 levels.翻译:疫情过后，亚太地区的全球旅游需求复苏落后于美国和欧洲。尽管自边境重新开放以来该地区的客运量激增，但国际航空公司的运力仍低于 2019 年的水平。

The supply-demand mismatch is driving up profit margins for carriers. Asia-Pacific was the second-best market for passenger earnings after transatlantic for both United and Delta in the third quarter.翻译:供需不匹配正在推高运营商的利润率。第三季度，亚太地区是美联航和达美航空继跨大西洋航线之后乘客收入第二高的市场。

Delta is shifting capacity to international leisure destinations as domestic flights grow more modestly. The Atlanta-based carrier will increase capacity to Asia-Pacific by as much as 50% in the December quarter and expects the new flying to be "profit-accretive."翻译:随着国内航班增长放缓，达美航空正在将运力转移到国际休闲目的地。这家总部位于亚特兰大的航空公司将在 12 月季度将飞往亚太地区的运力增加 50%，并预计新航班将“增加利润”。

Rival United also plans to ramp up capacity in Asia Pacific at the cost of domestic growth, as it bets on flights like U.S. to Manila, Philippines, and San Francisco to New Zealand to deliver the "strongest short-term results."翻译:竞争对手联合航空还计划以牺牲国内增长为代价来提高亚太地区的运力，因为该公司押注美国飞往菲律宾马尼拉和旧金山飞往新西兰等航班将带来“最强劲的短期业绩”。

Overall, Chicago-based United has almost doubled the number of seats on flights to Asia in the current quarter from a year ago, according to Cirium.翻译:据 Cirium 称，总体而言，总部位于芝加哥的美联航本季度飞往亚洲的航班座位数几乎比去年同期增加了一倍。

Across the border, Air Canada said the increase in Asia Pacific capacity would more than double its overall system growth.翻译:加拿大航空表示，亚太地区运力的增加将使其整个系统的增长增加一倍以上。

Demand for increasing flights to Asia out of Air Canada's Vancouver hub is expected to come partly from growing Asian immigration to Canada, along with U.S. passengers, Mark Galardo, vice president for network planning, said in an interview.翻译:负责网络规划的副总裁马克·加拉多(Mark Galardo)在接受采访时表示，加拿大航空温哥华枢纽飞往亚洲的航班需求增加，预计部分来​​自加拿大的亚洲移民以及美国乘客的增加。

Canada's largest carrier has a strategy of flying Americans from U.S. cities that connect through its Canadian hubs toward overseas destinations.翻译:加拿大最大的航空公司的战略是让美国人从美国城市出发，通过其加拿大枢纽飞往海外目的地。

About 80% of that traffic now goes to Europe, compared with 20% to Asia, but it would shift as Asian travel grows, Galardo said.翻译:Galardo 表示，目前大约 80% 的客流量流向欧洲，而只有 20% 流向亚洲，但随着亚洲旅游的增长，这种情况将会发生变化。

"Our forecast is that ... it would shift within a range of 5 to 10 percentage points," said Galardo, adding it was too early to give a specific number for next year.翻译:Galardo 表示：“我们的预测是……变化幅度将在 5 到 10 个百分点之间。”他补充说，现在给出明年的具体数字还为时过早。

However, closed Russian airspace as well as depressed Chinese travel to North America remain hurdles.翻译:然而，俄罗斯领空的封闭以及中国赴北美旅游的低迷仍然是障碍。

The need to avoid Russian airspace due to the war with Ukraine has made it tougher for North American carriers to fly to destinations like Hong Kong from East Coast hubs Newark, New Jersey; and Atlanta and Toronto.翻译:由于与乌克兰的战争，需要避开俄罗斯领空，这使得北美航空公司更难从东海岸枢纽新泽西州纽瓦克飞往香港等目的地；以及亚特兰大和多伦多。

Similarly, Chinese tourists are still not back in full force. In 2019, 2.8 million tourists from China came to the U.S., but research group Tourism Economics expects a mere 991,000 to arrive this year.翻译:同样，中国游客仍未全面回归。 2019年，有280万中国游客来到美国，但研究机构Tourism Economics预计今年仅有99.1万人次。

Uneven recovery in Chinese travel demand is an unknown for the carriers, but tight supply should help profit, Raymond James analyst Savanthi Syth said.翻译:Raymond James 分析师 Savanthi Syth 表示，中国旅行需求复苏的不均衡对航空公司来说是一个未知数，但供应紧张应该有助于盈利。

"I feel like Asia-Pacific is six-to-12 months behind what you've seen on the transatlantic – China being the wild card in all this," she said.翻译:“我觉得亚太地区比跨大西洋地区落后了 6 到 12 个月——中国是这一切的不确定因素，”她说。

Reporting by Allison Lampert in Montreal and Rajesh Kumar Singh in Chicago Editing by Ben Klayman and Matthew Lewis翻译:艾莉森·兰伯特在蒙特利尔报道和拉杰什·库马尔·辛格在芝加哥报道本·克莱曼和马修·刘易斯编辑

item.title: 亚洲足球周
item.description:
Talking points from the week in Asian football:

OSAKO STRIKES DEEP IN INJURY TIME TO KEEP KOBE ON TRACK

Vissel Kobe's Yuya Osako scored six minutes into added time to snatch a 2-1 win over Urawa Red Diamonds on Sunday and keep Takayuki Yoshida's side on track for a first J. League title.翻译:周日，神户胜利船队的大迫勇哉在补时六分钟内攻入一球，以 2-1 战胜浦和红钻队，让吉田隆之的球队有望首次夺得 J 联赛冠军。

Osako fired into an empty net after Urawa goalkeeper Shusaku Nishikawa went forward for a late corner in an attempt to claim the winner, only for the move to backfire as the former Japan international struck at the other end.翻译:浦和门将西川周作在最后时刻角球前插，试图夺取制胜球，但大迫的射门打入空门，这位前日本国脚在另一端射门，结果适得其反。

That late strike means Kobe lead defending champions Yokohama F Marinos by two points with two games remaining after Kevin Muscat's side earlier sealed a 2-0 win over Cerezo Osaka.

WANDERERS MOVE INTO A-LEAGUE TOP SPOT WITH PERTH WIN

Western Sydney Wanderers moved top of the A-League standings after second half goals from Jack Clisby and Tate Russell earned Marko Rudan's side a 2-0 win over Perth Glory on Saturday.翻译:周六，西悉尼流浪者队凭借杰克·克里斯比和泰特·拉塞尔下半场的进球，帮助马尔科·鲁丹的球队以 2-0 战胜珀斯光荣队，跃居澳超积分榜榜首。

The victory takes Wanderers to eight points after four games, ahead of Melbourne Victory and Wellington Phoenix on goal difference after the pair shared a 1-1 draw on Friday.翻译:这场胜利让流浪者队在四场比赛后获得8分，在周五1-1战平后，以净胜球优势领先于墨尔本胜利队和惠灵顿凤凰队。

Macarthur FC are also on eight points after being held to a 3-3 draw after Melbourne City's Jamie Maclaren and Terry Antonis scored in added time to earn Aurelio Vidmar's side a point.

MITROVIC STRIKES LATE AS AL-HILAL STAY UNBEATEN IN SAUDI

Al-Hilal's relentless run of form continued as Jorge Jesus' side handed Al Taawoun a 2-0 defeat on Thursday to remain four points clear of second-placed Al-Nassr in the Saudi Pro League after 13 matches.翻译:周四，豪尔赫·热苏斯的球队以 2-0 击败阿尔·塔文，阿尔希拉尔继续保持着不屈不挠的状态，在 13 场比赛之后，在沙特职业联赛中仍领先第二名阿尔·纳斯尔 4 分。

Aleksandar Mitrovic gave the Riyadh-based club the lead in the 81st minute before Mohammed Kanno netted nine minutes into injury time to make the points safe and ensure Al-Hilal maintained their unbeaten start to the league campaign.翻译:亚历山大·米特罗维奇 (Aleksandar Mitrovic) 在第 81 分钟为利雅得俱乐部取得领先，随后穆罕默德·坎诺 (Mohammed Kanno) 在伤停补时第 9 分钟攻入一球，确保积分安全，并确保阿尔希拉尔 (Al-Hilal) 保持联赛不败开局。

Cristiano Ronaldo scored Al-Nassr's third goal as they defeated Al Wehdat 3-1, while Karim Benzema hit a hat-trick for fifth-placed Al-Ittihad in their 4-2 win over Abha, the club's first game since coach Nuno Espirito Santo was fired on Tuesday.

AL-AIN, POHANG REACH ASIAN CHAMPIONS LEAGUE LAST 16

Al-Ain of the United Arab Emirates and South Korea's Pohang Steelers became the first teams to book places in the Asian Champions League last 16 as defending champions Urawa Red Diamonds continue to struggle.翻译:阿联酋艾因队和韩国浦项制铁队成为首批进入亚冠16强的球队，而卫冕冠军浦和红钻队则继续苦苦挣扎。

Pohang fought back to hand Urawa a 2-1 defeat on Wednesday to secure top spot in Group J with their fourth win in a row and put the Japanese side's hopes of qualifying for the next round in jeopardy with two rounds of group games remaining.翻译:周三，浦项队以2-1击败浦和队，以四连胜锁定J组头名位置，在小组赛还剩两轮的情况下，浦项队晋级下一轮的希望岌岌可危。

Al-Ain also notched up a fourth win with a 3-2 victory over Saudi Arabia's Al-Fayha sealing their spot in the round of 16, although they will go into the next phase without coach Alfred Schreuder, who quit on Wednesday.翻译:艾因队还以 3-2 战胜沙特阿拉伯队的法伊哈队取得了第四场胜利，锁定了 16 强的席位，尽管他们将在周三退出的教练阿尔弗雷德·施罗德 (Alfred Schreuder)缺席的情况下进入下一阶段。

item.title: 向太平洋提供安置方案是澳大利亚战胜中国的胜利
item.description:
Australia scored a significant win for influence in the Pacific Islands region with a trump card that China, seeking to expand security ties, doesn't have: the opportunity of resettlement.翻译:澳大利亚凭借一张寻求扩大安全关系的中国所没有的王牌，在太平洋岛屿地区的影响力上取得了重大胜利：重新安置的机会。

Under a security guarantee to the remote atoll nation of Tuvalu, which is threatened by rising sea levels, Australia will offer permanent residency to 280 Tuvalu citizens each year.翻译:根据对受到海平面上升威胁的偏远环礁国家图瓦卢的安全保障，澳大利亚每年将向 280 名图瓦卢公民提供永久居留权。

The treaty, signed on Friday by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and his counterpart Kausea Natano, could transform Australia's relationship with the Pacific, analysts say.翻译:分析人士称， 该条约由总理安东尼·阿尔巴内塞和总理考西亚·纳塔诺于周五签署，可能会改变澳大利亚与太平洋地区的关系。

"It is something China can't do," said Australian National University Pacific expert Graeme Smith.翻译:“这是中国做不到的，”澳大利亚国立大学太平洋分校专家格雷姆·史密斯说。

The treaty was announced after parliament recently passed legislation for a wider scheme offering permanent settlement for 3,000 Pacific Islanders annually in a ballot from next year.翻译:该条约是在议会最近通过立法制定一项更广泛的计划后宣布的，该计划从明年开始每年投票为 3,000 名太平洋岛民提供永久定居。

Defence Minister Richard Marles called the treaty with Tuvalu a "watershed in our relationship with the Pacific", representing a "much greater commitment for Australia to be providing more of Tuvalu's defence".翻译:国防部长理查德·马尔斯称与图瓦卢的条约是“我们与太平洋地区关系的分水岭”，代表“澳大利亚为图瓦卢提供更多防务做出了更大的承诺”。

The sequencing of Albanese's whirlwind of diplomatic visits - Washington, Beijing a week later, and then directly to a Pacific Islands leaders meeting in Rarotonga, sent "clear signals to everyone involved", said Peter Dean, director of foreign policy and defence at the United States Studies Centre in Sydney.翻译:联合国外交政策和防务主任彼得·迪恩表示，阿尔巴尼亚旋风式的外交访问——一周后访问华盛顿、北京，然后直接前往拉罗汤加举行太平洋岛屿领导人会议，向所有相关人员发出了“明确的信号”。悉尼国家研究中心。

"The number one strategic objective of Australian governments since federation in this region has been to ensure another great power whose interests are not aligned to its own doesn't get a foothold in the region," he said.翻译:他说：“自该地区联邦成立以来，澳大利亚政府的首要战略目标就是确保另一个与其利益不一致的大国无法在该地区立足。”

"China can turn up and offer more infrastructure money... they can't turn up and offer this kind of resettlement relationship. It serves as a model for the region."翻译:“中国可以出现并提供更多的基础设施资金……他们不能出现并提供这种安置关系。它可以成为该地区的典范。”

Despite the improved diplomatic tone between Australia and China after Albanese's tour last week, the first in seven years by an Australian leader, security tensions remain as Beijing expands its role in the Pacific Islands.翻译:尽管阿尔巴内斯上周出访（澳大利亚领导人七年来首次出访）后，澳大利亚和中国之间的外交气氛有所改善，但随着北京扩大其在太平洋岛屿的作用，安全紧张局势依然存在。

Australia has sent 450 police and military officers to Solomon Islands, which signed a security pact with China last year, to provide security for the Pacific Games which open on Sunday, joining regional forces from Fiji and Papua New Guinea, to ensure there is no gap for Chinese police to fill.翻译:澳大利亚已向去年与中国签署安全协议的所罗门群岛派遣了 450 名警察和军官，为周日开幕的太平洋运动会提供安全保障，并与斐济和巴布亚新几内亚的地区部队一道，确保不存在任何差距。供中国警方填写。

Australia also will be able to block any policing deal between China and Tuvalu - as well as any telecommunications, energy or port deal - under its treaty.翻译:根据其条约，澳大利亚还可以阻止中国与图瓦卢之间的任何警务协议以及任何电信、能源或港口协议。

State-owned China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) had built Tuvalu's harbour in 2019, to the concern of diplomatic ally Taiwan which lost Solomon Islands and Kiribati to Beijing's overtures in the same year.翻译:国有的中国土木工程建设公司（CCECC）于 2019 年建造了图瓦卢港口，这引起了外交盟友台湾的担忧，台湾在同年因北京的示好而失去了所罗门群岛和基里巴斯。

"The game is not going to pause because Australia and China relations are a bit warmer, or even if China-U.S. competition somehow diminishes a bit," said Smith.翻译:史密斯表示：“比赛不会因为澳大利亚和中国关系回暖而暂停，或者即使中美竞争在某种程度上减弱。”

Wang Yiwei, an international relations professor at the Renmin University in Beijing, said rivalry between China and the United States in the Pacific Islands, with each seeking to block the other, had heightened Australia's sensitivity to every Chinese move.翻译:北京人民大学国际关系教授王义伟表示，中美在太平洋岛屿上的竞争，双方都试图阻止对方，这提高了澳大利亚对中国一举一动的敏感度。

The "strategic game" between China and the U.S. was now on Australia's doorstep, he said.翻译:他说，中美之间的“战略博弈”现在已经到了澳大利亚家门口。

"Cooperation in the Pacific region tends to focus on non-traditional security, including maintenance of public security and infrastructure to deal with climate change," he added.翻译:他补充说：“太平洋地区的合作往往侧重于非传统安全，包括维护公共安全和应对气候变化的基础设施。”

"These should not be considered too security-related, but the United States is still relatively sensitive, and Australia is also more sensitive."翻译:“这些不应该被认为太与安全相关，但美国还是比较敏感的，澳大利亚也比较敏感。”

Reporting by Kirsty Needham in Sydney and Martin Pollard in Beijing; Editing by Miral Fahmy翻译:悉尼的 Kirsty Needham 和北京的 Martin Pollard 报道；米拉尔·法赫米编辑

item.title: 埃赫曼押注锂，加大对大型矿山的投资
item.description:
Eramet (ERMT.PA) will go ahead with plans to add more capacity in Argentina for the battery mineral lithium and aims to double nickel mine output in Indonesia, in an investment push it sees withstanding a faltering global economy.翻译:Eramet (ERMT.PA)将继续实施在阿根廷增加电池矿物锂产能的计划，并计划将印度尼西亚的镍矿产量增加一倍，该公司认为，在全球经济步履蹒跚的情况下，这是一项投资举措。

The French mining group forecast on Monday capital expenditure of about 1.9 billion euros ($2.03 billion) over 2024-2026, an increase in annual investment from 550 million euros expected this year.翻译:法国矿业集团周一预测，2024-2026 年的资本支出约为 19 亿欧元（20.3 亿美元），比今年预期的 5.5 亿欧元增加了年度投资。

"These investments are being made in areas with very high growth," Christel Bories, Eramet's chair and CEO, told Reuters. "Lithium is not tied to world economic growth, it's tied to the development of batteries and the energy transition."翻译:埃赫曼董事长兼首席执行官克里斯特尔·博里斯 (Christel Bories) 告诉路透社：“这些投资是在增长非常快的领域进行的。” “锂与世界经济增长无关，它与电池的发展和能源转型有关。”

The group said it had approved a second phase for its Centenario lithium project in Argentina to produce about 30,000 metric tons annually of lithium carbonate equivalent (LCE), on top of the 24,000 tons targeted in a first tranche that will enter production in the second quarter of 2024.翻译:该集团表示，已批准其位于阿根廷的 Centenario 锂项目第二阶段，每年生产约 30,000 吨碳酸锂当量 (LCE)，第一阶段的目标产量为 24,000 吨，将于第二季度投入生产2024 年。

As well as studying a possible third tranche at Centenario, the firm is exploring the nearby Arizaro deposit, Bories said before Eramet's first capital markets day.翻译:Bories 在 Eramet 首个资本市场日之前表示，除了研究 Centenario 可能的第三批矿藏外，该公司还在勘探附近的 Arizaro 矿床。

Eramet is developing Centenario with Chinese steel giant Tsingshan. A $400 million deal with Glencore (GLEN.L) to market lithium from the project's first stage will mostly cover Eramet's financing needs for the next tranche, Bories said.翻译:Eramet 正在与中国钢铁巨头青山钢铁共同开发 Centenario。 Bories 表示，与 Glencore (GLEN.L)达成的一项价值 4 亿美元的协议，用于销售该项目第一阶段的锂，将主要满足 Eramet 下一阶段的融资需求。

In Chile, meanwhile, the group said it had acquired for an initial $95 million a 120,000-hectare lithium concession in the Atacama region.翻译:与此同时，在智利，该集团表示已以 9500 万美元的初始价格收购了阿塔卡马地区 12 万公顷的锂矿特许权。

Eramet wants to bring output at Weda Bay in Indonesia, the world's largest nickel mine that it also operates with Tsingshan, to 60 million wet metric tons in 2026 from 30 million anticipated this year.翻译:埃赫曼希望将印度尼西亚 Weda Bay 的产量从今年预计的 3,000 万湿吨增至 2026 年。Weda Bay 是该公司与青山共同运营的全球最大镍矿。

The group aims to process some of the Weda Bay ore into battery-grade nickel and cobalt in a joint venture with German chemical group BASF (BASFn.DE), with a decision due next year.翻译:该集团计划与德国化工集团巴斯夫(BASFn.DE)成立合资企业，将韦达湾的部分矿石加工成电池级镍和钴，并将于明年做出决定。

It also plans to increase ore output in Gabon, where it operates the world's largest manganese mine, to 8.5 million tons in 2026 from about 7 million expected in 2023, mainly through improvements to a rail transport link.翻译:该公司还计划主要通过改善铁路运输线路，将加蓬的矿石产量从 2023 年预计的约 700 万吨增加到 2026 年的 850 万吨。该公司在加蓬运营着世界上最大的锰矿。

The competitiveness of its top mines and the sale of less profitable metallurgical businesses allows Eramet to invest in a weaker cycle marked by economic uncertainty in commodity powerhouse China, Bories said.翻译:博里斯表示，其顶级矿山的竞争力以及利润较低的冶金业务的出售，使埃赫曼能够在大宗商品大国中国经济不确定性的疲软周期中进行投资。

"The outlook for 2024 is not very favourable," she said. "But despite the very sharp fall in metal prices we are managing to hold up."翻译:“2024 年的前景不太乐观，”她说。 “但尽管金属价格大幅下跌，我们仍设法坚持住。”

However, in New Caledonia its nickel subsidiary SLN remains in financial difficulties, and has entered another court conciliation process after using up the latest loan from the French government, Bories said.翻译:然而，Bories 表示，其在新喀里多尼亚的镍子公司 SLN 仍面临财务困难，并在用完法国政府的最新贷款后已进入另一场法院调解程序。

With Eramet refusing to inject more money into SLN and Glencore only providing funding to end-February for the Koniambo Nickel SAS (KNS) operation it co-owns, the authorities need to agree measures in the coming weeks to salvage a nickel industry depleted by energy costs and political tensions, she said.翻译:由于 Eramet 拒绝向 SLN 注入更多资金，而嘉能可仅在 2 月底前为其共同拥有的 Koniambo Nickel SAS (KNS) 业务提供资金，当局需要在未来几周内就拯救能源枯竭的镍行业达成一致。她说，成本和政治紧张局势。

Reporting by Gus Trompiz, Editing by Charlotte Van Campenhout and Louise Heavens翻译:格斯·特罗姆皮兹报道，夏洛特·范坎彭豪特和路易丝·天堂编辑
item.author: Gus Trompiz

item.title: 随着北京加强做市计划，Citadel 证券探索中国牌照
item.description:
Citadel Securities, one of the world's biggest market-making firms, is "actively exploring" establishing a licensed onshore business in China, its chief executive Peng Zhao said.翻译:Citadel 证券首席执行官赵鹏表示，Citadel 证券是全球最大的做市商之一，正在“积极探索”在中国建立持牌境内业务。

If Citadel Securities were to obtain a licence, it would be the first foreign firm to formally foray into market-making in China outside interbank and foreign exchange market making.翻译:如果 Citadel 证券获得牌照，它将成为除银行间和外汇做市之外第一家正式涉足中国做市业务的外国公司。

Over the last two years, Chinese authorities have encouraged the development of market makers, approving more licences and pledging to roll out more types of derivatives as they seek to boost liquidity and draw in more long-term capital.翻译:过去两年，中国当局鼓励做市商的发展，批准了更多牌照，并承诺推出更多类型的衍生品，以提高流动性并吸引更多长期资本。

At least 16 domestic securities brokerage firms have been given the nod to act as market makers in China A shares as of mid-September, official records show.翻译:官方记录显示，截至9月中旬，至少有16家国内券商获准担任中国A股做市商。

"We are pleased to see the introduction of the market-making program in China," Zhao told Reuters in an interview in Hong Kong. He declined to disclose the specific licence the company might seek.翻译:“我们很高兴看到中国推出做市计划，”赵在香港接受路透社采访时表示。他拒绝透露该公司可能寻求的具体许可。

"As the Chinese capital market continues to grow beyond simple stock trading and into more complex products, the concept of market making not only will come naturally but also becomes necessary instead of just adding value from a liquidity perspective," Zhao said.翻译:“随着中国资本市场不断从简单的股票交易发展到更复杂的产品，做市的概念不仅会自然而然地出现，而且变得必要，而不仅仅是从流动性角度增加价值，”赵说。

Billionaire Ken Griffin's Citadel Securities, which handles about $390 billion in trades per day, is one of the top market makers by trading volume in the United States.翻译:亿万富翁 Ken Griffin 的 Citadel 证券每天处理约 3900 亿美元的交易，是美国交易量最大的做市商之一。

Market makers quote both buy and sell prices for assets and are constant trading participants in the market, earning profit through the spread of bid and offer prices.翻译:做市商提供资产的买入和卖出价格，并且是市场上的持续交易参与者，通过买入价和卖出价的价差赚取利润。

China's nascent market-making sector could grow to be worth 250 billion yuan ($34 billion) in revenues in 2032, compared with an estimated 40 billion yuan last year, according to Chinese brokerage Haitong.翻译:据中国券商海通称，中国新兴的做市行业到 2032 年的收入可能会增长到 2500 亿元人民币（340 亿美元），而去年估计为 400 亿元人民币。

Market-making was first introduced in China in 2014. In February, Beijing started to allow licenced securities brokerage firms to act as market makers for its newest board Beijing Stock Exchange, following a similar move in May 2022 for its Nasdaq-style STAR Market.翻译:中国于 2014 年首次引入做市制度。今年 2 月，北京开始允许持牌证券经纪公司担任其最新主板北京证券交易所的做市商，继 2022 年 5 月在纳斯达克风格的科创板市场采取类似举措后。

Citadel Securities in July appointed Tony Tang, the former head of BlackRock's China business, to helm its China operations.翻译:Citadel 证券于 7 月任命贝莱德中国业务前负责人 Tony Tang 负责其中国业务。

In February, it became a "qualified foreign institutional investor" in China, a few months after the country allowed qualified foreign institutions to trade more broadly in domestic futures and options instruments.翻译:今年二月，在中国允许合格境外机构更广泛地进行国内期货和期权工具交易几个月后，该公司成为中国的“合格境外机构投资者”。

The wider access it gained with that licence covers bonds, futures and options in addition to stocks it traded via China's Stock Connect Programme.翻译:除了通过中国股市互联互通计划交易的股票之外，该公司获得了更广泛的准入范围，涵盖债券、期货和期权。

This year, Citadel Securities also launched an investment-grade corporate bond market-making business in the United States. It is now looking to bring that business to Asia. Currently, it focuses on helping clients in Asia trade in U.S. assets such as U.S. Treasuries and U.S. dollar interest rate swaps.翻译:今年，Citadel 证券还在美国推出了投资级公司债券做市业务。该公司现在正寻求将该业务带到亚洲。目前，它专注于帮助亚洲客户进行美国国债和美元利率掉期等美国资产交易。

Since 2020, the brokerage has more than doubled its Asia Pacific headcount to nearly 300 people, a contrast to the wider trend of Wall Street layoffs amid depressed deal activity due to high interest rates and geopolitical uncertainty.翻译:自 2020 年以来，该券商的亚太区员工人数增加了一倍多，达到近 300 人，这与高利率和地缘政治不确定性导致交易活动低迷导致华尔街裁员的更广泛趋势形成鲜明对比。

Reporting by Summer Zhen and Selena Li in Hong Kong; Editing by Sumeet Chatterjee and Edwina Gibbs翻译:甄夏和李赛琳在香港的报道；苏米特·查特吉和埃德温娜·吉布斯编辑
item.author: Selena Li, Summer Zhen

item.title: 早盘竞价：芯片股欢呼雀跃，其他股则回落
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland翻译:凯文·巴克兰 (Kevin Buckland) 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望

Chip stocks gave Asian equity investors some small bit of cheer to start the week, picking up where Wall Street left off while U.S. yields stayed subdued, which kept a lid on the dollar, too.翻译:本周伊始，芯片股给亚洲股市投资者带来了一些小小鼓舞，在华尔街股市停顿的情况下有所回升，而美国收益率依然低迷，这也限制了美元的走势。

But elsewhere, bears were firmly in control.翻译:但在其他地方，空头牢牢控制着局面。

A lot of that can likely be traced to China, rather than to the Moody's downgrade to the outlook for the U.S. sovereign debt rating, which investors have taken in stride.翻译:其中很大一部分原因很可能是中国造成的，而不是穆迪对美国主权债务评级前景的下调，投资者对此泰然处之。

The Chinese consumer has so far refused to ride to the rescue of the world's second-largest economy. Monthly retail sales data is due on Wednesday but the country's Singles Day shopping extraganza over the weekend - equivalent to Black Friday sales elsewhere - recorded only meagre growth.翻译:迄今为止，中国消费者拒绝出手拯救世界第二大经济体。月度零售销售数据将于周三公布，但该国周末的双十一购物狂欢——相当于其他地方的黑色星期五销售——仅录得微弱增长。

Looking across the region, Japan's tech-heavy Nikkei managed to keep its head above water, buoyed by gains for its two biggest chip-related shares; Taiwan's benchmark advanced 0.8%.翻译:纵观整个地区，日本以科技股为主的日经指数在其两只最大的芯片相关股票上涨的提振下成功保持了水面。台湾股市基准上涨 0.8%。

But Hong Kong flipped from early gains to a loss of about 0.15%. A sub-index of tech shares remained firmly positive but another of mainland property developers slumped more than 1%.翻译:但香港股市从早盘上涨转为下跌约 0.15%。科技股分类指数依然坚挺，但另一家内地房地产开发商则下跌超过 1%。

China's blue chips fell 0.5%.翻译:中国蓝筹股下跌0.5%。

U.S. retail sales data is also due on Wednesday, preceded by CPI a day earlier. The figures could be key in helping the Federal Reserve to plot the path ahead for interest rates, including whether another hike is needed.翻译:美国零售销售数据也将于周三公布，消费者物价指数 (CPI) 早于前一天公布。这些数据可能是帮助美联储规划未来利率路径的关键，包括是否需要再次加息。

The Fed's rhetoric has taken a hawkish turn recently, but markets so far are more focused on the data, particularly the soft non-farm payrolls numbers at the start of this month.翻译:美联储的言论最近转向鹰派，但迄今为止市场更关注数据，尤其是本月初疲软的非农就业数据。

ECB President Christine Lagarde last week said that rates will stay restrictive at least for several quarters. Lagarde deputy Luis de Guindos has his say a little later today, giving the keynote speech to kick off Euro Finance Week.翻译:欧洲央行行长拉加德上周表示，利率将至少在几个季度内保持限制性。拉加德副手路易斯·德金多斯今天晚些时候发表讲话，为欧洲金融周拉开序幕。

Elswhere, Bank of England board member Catherine L. Mann will take the podium, after the bank's chief economist, Huw Pill, said last week its projection that monetary policy will need to remain restrictive for an extended period should not be taken as a promise.翻译:在其他地方，英格兰银行董事会成员凯瑟琳·L·曼(Catherine L. Mann)将走上讲台，此前该行首席经济学家休·皮尔(Huw Pill)上周表示，其关于货币政策将需要在较长时期内保持限制性的预测不应被视为承诺。

Key developments that could influence markets on Monday:翻译:可能影响周一市场的主要事态发展：

-ECB's de Guindos, BoE's Mann speak翻译:-欧洲央行德金多斯、英国央行曼恩讲话

-UK Rightmove house prices翻译:-英国Rightmove房价

-Sweden SEB housing翻译:-瑞典SEB住房

-New York Fed consumer expectations survey翻译:-纽约联储消费者预期调查

Reporting by Kevin Buckland; Editing by Edmund Klamann翻译:凯文·巴克兰报道；编辑：埃德蒙·克拉曼

item.title: 亚太经合组织经济增长将因持续通胀和中美紧张局势而放缓
item.description:
Economic growth among Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation countries is expected to decline next year and remain below the global average as higher interest rates slow U.S. growth, as China continues to struggle with its recovery and tensions between the two hamper trade, the body said on Sunday.翻译:亚太经合组织周日表示，由于美国经济增长放缓，中国继续在复苏中苦苦挣扎，以及两国之间的紧张关系阻碍了贸易，亚太经济合作组织国家的经济增长预计明年将下降，并仍低于全球平均水平。

The APEC Secretariat's Policy Support Unit issued new forecasts on the eve of the APEC leaders' summit in San Francisco, showing that the 21-country region's growth rate would dip to 2.8% in 2024 from 3.3% in 2023.翻译:APEC秘书处政策支持小组在旧金山APEC领导人峰会前夕发布新预测，显示21国地区的增长率将从2023年的3.3%降至2024年的2.8%。

The APEC GDP growth rate will average 2.9% in 2025 and 2026, below the global average of 3.2% and 3.5-3.6% in the rest of the world.翻译:2025年和2026年APEC GDP增长率平均为2.9%，低于全球平均水平3.2%和世界其他地区3.5-3.6%。

Among key downside risks for the Pacific Rim region are persistent inflation associated with export restrictions, weather conditions that have raised the price of rice and other agricultural products, and disruptions in the fertilizer supply chain. Taming inflation could require more monetary policy tightening, slowing growth further.翻译:环太平洋地区的主要下行风险包括与出口限制相关的持续通货膨胀、导致大米和其他农产品价格上涨的天气条件以及化肥供应链的中断。抑制通胀可能需要进一步收紧货币政策，从而进一步放缓经济增长。

Trade volume growth for goods is set to rebound next year among APEC countries after a largely flat 2023 due to China's sluggish growth, rising to 4.3% for goods exports and 3.5% for goods imports. But growth of both exports and imports are forecast to peak at 4.4% in 2025, declining slightly in 2026 due to geo-political fragmentation that is disrupting longstanding supply relationships.翻译:由于中国增长乏力，APEC 国家的货物贸易量增长在 2023 年基本持平后，明年将出现反弹，货物出口增长至 4.3%，货物进口增长至 3.5%。但预计出口和进口增长将在 2025 年达到 4.4% 的峰值，并在 2026 年因地缘政治分裂破坏长期供应关系而略有下降。

Carlos Kuriyama, director of the APEC policy support unit, said the data show that it was important for the U.S. and China to patch up their differences after years of tariff battles and national security export restrictions.翻译:APEC政策支持部门主任卡洛斯·栗山表示，数据显示，经过多年的关税战和国家安全出口限制，美国和中国弥合分歧非常重要。

U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping are expected to meet in-person for the first time in a year on Wednesday in a high-stakes session aimed at curbing tensions between the world's two largest economies.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平预计将于周三举行一年来首次面对面会面，这是一场旨在遏制世界最大两个经济体之间紧张关系的高风险会议。

Kuriyama said that national security-driven export controls and other restrictions between the U.S. and China are driving up costs in supply chains that were previously optimized for efficiency. While a full return to pre-COVID-19 trading patterns is not possible, avoiding further fragmentation is important, he added.翻译:栗山表示，美国和中国之间以国家安全为导向的出口管制和其他限制正在推高供应链的成本，而此前这些供应链是为了提高效率而优化的。他补充说，虽然不可能完全恢复到 COVID-19 之前的交易模式，但避免进一步的碎片化很重要。

The data shows "how important it is to re-engage, de-risk and avoid decoupling" of the U.S. and Chinese economies. "I think a stable relationship within U.S. and China is a win-win situation for everyone," Kuriyama said.翻译:这些数据显示了中美经济“重新接触、降低风险和避免脱钩的重要性”。 “我认为中美之间稳定的关系对每个人来说都是双赢的局面，”栗山说。
